messages.message:
Hey. Interesting feedback from a BMG configuration user, building a solution to extract 40+ fields from Recording License Agreements (40+ page contracts), as he tests between Text Extraction and Document Reasoning.
> Text Extraction sometimes fails and doesn't extract anything. But Document Reasoning works well.
> Can we have a way in a single field - if the default chosen field type returns no option - there is a backup field type (e.g. Document Reasoning as a back up to Text Extraction)?
More details :point_down:
Hmm backup field logic is interesting. @lydia / @Serena do you know if this has come up in the past?

usually users will try to extract the same value in several ways, and then they’ll use a custom function (or in the future, a derived field would also work) to pick the correct value out of those attempts (see notes from user interview with Lee (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EA_xQ6h3_5VjE3kL277ri2kwzrMcY-sMqRh-xp2D_yU/edit?disco=AAABSP2uzIM))

for example:
• create fields “credit card number 1”, “credit card number 2", “credit card number 3” all with different prompts
• create a derived field with the prompt `Return the first valid credit card number out of credit card number 1, credit card number 2, or credit card number 3`
Yeah this makes sense! @Tom Murphy this is something that becomes easier as we introduce custom functions/derived fields
@Tom Murphy do you have any more detail on when it didn't work well? this would be valuable feedback for the model dev team to continue improving accuracy

We're speaking with this team (and Erdem, who's continuing to build it out) on Thurs. We can ask there, but maybe want to focus the trial on capabilities we have today - and once their trial is completed at the end of the month, I'm sure we can ask for say a product review / feedback separate session. @vtilva, thoughts here?
